title: Chicken Tikka Masala
directions: Place chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, tomato puree, yogurt, olive oil, garam masala, tumeric powder, cumin, paprika, salt, cinnamon, ground black pepper, and cayenne pepper in a large bowl. With a spatula, stir to combine everything and make sure the chicken is coated well.
Gently place the mixture in the insert of the crockpot and add the two bay leaves.
Cover and cook for 8 hours on low (or 4 hours on high).

When done, in a medium bowl, whisk together heavy cream and corn starch, then pour the mixture into the crockpot and gently stir. Let cook an additional 20 minutes to thicken up. Squeeze half a lemon over the mixture then stir to incorporate.
Serve hot over a bed of rice.
ingredients: 8 boneless, skinless chicken tenderloins (about 3 lbs.) - cut into 1.5" cubes
¾ tsp. fresh ground black pepper
Lemon juice from half a small lemon
